lead_paragraph: LORELLO--Alexis Caputo, on March 28, 2016. Our precious "Sweet Pea" has shown strength, determination and resilience. She bravely fought the last two years living with Cystic Fibrosis. Alexis taught us the true meaning of courage. We were all truly blessed to have had her in our lives. Beloved wife of Kenneth David Lorello. Loving daughter of Andrew and Catherine Caputo. Cherished sister of Joanne (Brian) Faber, Cathie (Joe) Morgani, Andrea (Ken) Brodlieb, Marie (Michael) Zatkowski, Guy Caputo and John (Maria) Scifo. Adored daughter-in-law of Janet Johnson and Anthony (Camille) Lorello. Treasured sister-in-law of Anthony (Sheila) Lorello and Vincent Lorello. Dear aunt of many nieces, nephews and two great-nieces. Loved by her furry babies, Madison, Sam and Bella. Reposing at The Fredrick J. Chapey & Sons East Islip Funeral Home, 200 East Main Street, (1/2 mile west of the S.S. Parkway, Exit 45W). Celebration of the liturgy of Christian Burial Saturday at 9:30am at St Joseph's RC Church, Ronkonkoma, LI. Entombment to follow at St. Charles Cemetery, Farmingdale, LI. In lieu of flowers, donations in Alexis' loving memory may be made to The Cystic Fibrosis Foundation, 1 Huntington Quadrangle #

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  LORELLO, ALEXIS CAPUTO
